column2: We are urgently hiring for MDM   Overview : As an MDM Data Steward in Amneal Pharmaceuticals, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality, consistency, and governance of customer data across the organization.  This position requires a strong understanding of data management principles, project management skills, stakeholder management capabilities, and preferably prior experience in Master Data Management (MDM). You will be responsible for data governance, data rationalization, and driving initiatives to improve data quality and usability within Amneal.  The primary domain for this position is Customer Master data, but the candidate will work very closely with all master data domains including Product master, Vendor master as well as several reference data domains.     Key Responsibilities:      1. Data   Governance: Develop   and enforce data governance policies, standards, and procedures for the   Customer Master Domain. Collaborate   with cross-functional teams to ensure compliance with data governance   policies and procedures. 2. Data   Management: Oversee   the lifecycle of customer master data, including creation, maintenance, and   retirement processes. Identify   and resolve data quality issues, working closely with business stakeholders   and IT teams. Implement   data management best practices to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and   consistency. 3. Data   Rationalization: Conduct   data profiling and analysis to identify duplicate, inconsistent, or redundant   data within the Customer Master Domain. Lead   data rationalization efforts to standardize and consolidate customer data   across disparate systems and sources. 4. Project   Management: Engage   in MDM projects related to the Customer Master Domain, including data   migration, integration, and system enhancements. Implement   a Customer MDM solution, including customer hierarchies, data cleansing and   data mastering and approval flows. This data will be used in downstream   systems like eCommerce platforms, supply chain systems and others.  5. Stakeholder   Management: Engage   with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and   priorities. Act   as a liaison between business users, IT teams, and external vendors to   address data-related issues and concerns. Build   strong relationships with stakeholders to promote data governance and drive   alignment on data management initiatives. Given   the global user base, effective verbal and written communications are   critical to success.  Experience :       2+years of experience working in Data Governance or Data Management within        a global manufacturing company    2+ years of experience working with data in the specific domain (i.e.,        Customer, Product, Material, Vendor) in an ERP system context (Item/Material        master, BOM, Routing, Production, Customer master, Vendor master) Interested candidate can share CVs @  bhuvneshwari.rathore@amneal.com   Subject : CV for MDM

Ecolab is searching for a driven  Fixed Asset Supervisor I  for future opportunities within our  Finance division  in  Pune, India . Ecolab is seeking a supervisor to join our Finance team.  This is a key role responsible for leading and coordinating the team activities and serving as a finance partner to divisions and functions across the company.   Whats in it For You:   You will join a growth company offering a  competitive salary and benefits. The ability to make an impact and  shape your career  with a company that is passionate about growth.  The support of an organization that  believes  it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives and ideas to achieve our best. Design and develop training programs on as needed basis. Ensure cost control and efficiency through automation and standardization, delivering top quality services to internal and external clients. column2: Job Summary. As a Billing Specialist, you will be responsible for ensuring accurate and timely invoicing to clients or customers. Working closely with the finance and sales teams, you will oversee the invoicing process, generate invoices, and address any billing inquiries or discrepancies. Your attention to detail and commitment to efficiency will be critical in maintaining positive relationships with clients and supporting the financial health of the organization.  Roles & Responsibilities. Invoice Generation: Prepare and generate invoices accurately and promptly based on sales orders, contracts, or service agreements. Billing Verification: Review billing information for accuracy, including pricing, quantities, discounts, and taxes, to ensure compliance with contractual terms and company policies. Invoice Delivery: Distribute invoices to clients or customers via email, mail, or electronic billing platforms, ensuring timely delivery and receipt. Billing Inquiries: Respond to billing inquiries and resolve customer issues or discrepancies related to invoices, payments, or billing statements. Payment Processing: Monitor incoming payments, reconcile payments against invoices, and follow up on outstanding balances or overdue invoices. Record Keeping: Maintain accurate records of invoices, payments, and billing communications in the accounting or billing system, ensuring data integrity and compliance with record-keeping standards. Reporting: Prepare and analyze billing reports, metrics, and aging analyses to track billing performance, aging receivables, and cash flow projections. Customer Service: Provide excellent customer service to clients or customers, addressing inquiries, concerns, and requests related to billing in a timely and professional manner. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline and improve the invoicing process, implementing best practices, automation tools, and process enhancements to increase efficiency and accuracy. Collaboration: Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including sales, finance, and customer service teams, to resolve billing issues, address customer needs, and support business objectives. Qualifications. Education: Bachelors degree in accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field. Relevant certifications in accounting or billing are a plus. Experience: Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in billing, invoicing, or accounts receivable roles, preferably in a corporate or financial services environment. Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in reviewing and processing billing information, ensuring data integrity and compliance with billing standards. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze billing data, identify discrepancies, and resolve billing issues effectively. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly and professionally with clients, colleagues, and stakeholders. Organizational Skills: Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Technology Proficiency: Proficiency in billing software, accounting systems, and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook). Experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle) is a plus. Customer Focus: Strong customer service orientation with a commitment to providing high-quality service and addressing customer needs and inquiries promptly and effectively. Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to achieve common goals and objectives. Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities, requirements, and business needs, with a proactive and solution-oriented approach to addressing billing challenges.

column2: This analyst is responsible for leading a wide range of advanced duties and responsibilities involving the application of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and theories in the management of financial accounts and operations.                            Duties include, but are not limited to:              Planning and circulating monthly timelines to accounting and business teams across all Lennox entities laying cut-off date for each of the lease, hedge, financial reporting, utility rebate and sales tax activities that are carried out through-out the month          Review the newly abstracted incremental leases in lease management tool, observe the adhoc issues related to process, systems, etc that emerges and address them          Review the lease invoice entries and adjustment entries accounted during the month          Perform reconciliation of lease general ledgers and provide necessary adjustment entries          Get the final reconciliation prepared by the team member and review as part of month close activities          Address various questions/clarification raised by auditors, business units, accounting units and within the team from time to time on all verticals of the team (lease, technical accounting, utility rebates and sales tax ECM)          Candidate should prepare/review quarterly and annual workpapers required for lease accounting disclosures          Additionally, the candidate should be involved in preparing financial statement footnotes, management discussion and analysis for 10Q/10K.          Apart from above lease activities, the candidate must be involved in preparing/reviewing Accounting Disclosure Checklist based on quarterly/annual model financial statements before auditors clearance. Perform overall review of 10K/10Q just before the date of filing.          The candidate should be open to manage automation / process improvement projects across the team. Somebody good with automation tools would be an advantage.          The candidate should have established a strong stakeholder relationship in the current/previous roles. Able to perform multiple task at a given point in time                Qualifications                The candidate should be a qualified Chartered Accountant with an experience ranging from 3-5 years.          Experience from big four accounting firms is an added advantage.                The candidate should either have strong knowledge in ASC842 Lease Accounting Standard or can bring it up to speed before taking up the role.            Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Word. Knowledge of enterprise systems (eg, SAP) preferred.                Possess strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.

From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience,  we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget.  In addition to our flagship brand,  Hilton Hotels & Resorts,  the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria,  LXR,  Conrad,  Canopy,  Curio Collection,  DoubleTree,  Hilton Garden Inn,  Hampton and many others.      If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world,  you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member.  Because it s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests,  Team Members,  and owners alike.          The core responsibilities of the Assistant Manager - Cost are to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of cost control,  storerooms,  receiving and assist management in keeping the cost of food,  beverage and other supplies to a minimum.            What will I be doing?       As the Assistant Manager - Cost,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:       Supervise Cost Clerks,  Storekeepers,  and Receiving Clerks.        Ensure that all incoming goods are received via the receiving area,  with deliveries properly checked against purchase orders and market lists.        Ensure the security of all stores,  including proper restrictions on the issue of keys and general access.        Record and verify on a daily basis all food and beverage invoices for price extension,  total and unit prices which should conform to the approved market prices.        Ensure all inventory items are correctly set up in the hotel inventory system including sizes,  descriptions,  purchase units etc.        Ensure that proper records are kept of inventory receipts,  issues,  returns and transfers and proper authorization thereof.        Inspect and test goods whenever necessary especially with regard to food and beverage items.        Ensure that accumulated daily invoices agree to amounts transferred to Accounts Payable.        Make regular spot checks and inspections of storerooms,  receiving area,  and all outlets.        Check duty invoices to ensure that correct duty has been applied.        Have full and extensive knowledge of the hotel inventory system and be responsible for the maintenance of the system.        Report immediately to the Director of Finance (DOF) / Assistant Financial Controller (AFC) if any system errors are detected.        Train users on the hotel inventory system and assist in the setup of requisition lists,  purchasing lists,  etc.        Ensure all inventory items are correctly set up in the hotel inventory system including sizes,  descriptions,  purchase units,  etc.        Ensure that proper records of inventory receipts,  issues,  returns and transfers are kept and proper authorization thereof.        Ensure that the loading dock is kept clean and tidy at all times,  free from clutter and hazards.        Maintain adequate control on all inward and outward goods into the loading dock and storerooms.        Maintain vigilance in ensuring the security of the loading dock.        Prepare daily and monthly cost reports according to operational requirements,  organize cost communication meetings,  and participate in profit and loss meetings when necessary.        Ensure current par stock levels are maintained and constantly reviewed.        Introduce stringent cost control measures.        Monitor and investigate spoilage and recommend appropriate actions to reduce.        Co-ordinate with the F&B Manager and Executive Chef on recipe costings and recommended retail prices for food and beverage items.        Co-ordinate with other operating departments to perform costings and recommended selling prices.        Execute and coordinate the inventory of operation equipment and fixed assets with related department.        Conduct and co-ordinate monthly stock takes of outlets and storerooms as well as operating equipment with concerned departments.        Conduct market price surveys together with the Purchasing Manager and Executive Chef.        Prepare monthly listing of slow moving and obsolete stock items with recommendations for action,  ensuring that the received items are within the valid period to minimize spoilage.        Co-ordinate with other departments,  especially F&B Department regarding cost matters.        Calculate daily cost of sales regarding officer s checks and entertainment bills.        Work closely with Purchasing Manager and Department Heads to minimize the cost without sacrificing the quality.        Monitor food cost of sales on a regular basis to ensure it s in line with budget.        Flexible in relation to working hours.        Maintain good relations with other hotel departments.        Handle all requests and enquiries in a timely,  efficient and friendly manner.        Minimize the risks of accidents and workers compensation costs by ensuring the correct work practices are used and that the area is safe from hazards.        Carry out any other reasonable duties and responsibilities as assigned.                        What are we looking for?      An Assistant Manager - Cost serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. Previous experience in a managerial operational accounting role.        Knowledge of cost control.        Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.        Mature and reliable person. column2: Hello We have an exciting career opportunity at NRB Bearings, Aurangabad (Chikhalthana Location) for a Plant Account Position. Your skills and experience may align well with this role, and we believe you would be an asset to our team. A brief about company, NRB Bearings Limited: A Complete Friction Solutions Provider, from Design to Delivery. Founded in 1965, NRB Bearings was the first company to manufacture needle roller bearings in India. Listed in 1995 as Public limited company on the Bombay Stock Exchange & National Stock Exchange. For over 50 years NRB has pioneered leading edge roller bearings technology. Today 90% of vehicles on Indian roads run on NRB parts. Since inception, NRB has grown to offer a wide range of high precision friction solutions across mobility applications. We are key suppliers to the Mobility industry segment in the automotive OEMs (commercial vehicles, passenger cars, 2/3 wheelers, farm equipment & tractors), replacement market, the railways, aerospace & defence related industries. Its global client list includes all the world leaders viz. Getrag, Honda, John Deere, Maruti Suzuki, Mercedes Benz, Volvo and ZF just to name a few. NRB has close to 70 percent market share in India for needle bearings and globally is a market leader in automotive cylindrical bearings with a grown rate of 46% in this segment. Built on world-class engineering and quality driven manufacturing infrastructure, NRB today has 6 plants in India and 1 in Thailand. Its supply logistics enables it to export all over the world, and today it supplies bearings and allied products to customers in 26 countries across 5 continents including Brazil, China, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Russia, Sweden, the Czech Republic and the USA. NRB envisions itself to be the recognised leader in the design and production of customized friction solutions with a presence in every vehicle in the world. Web Site: www.nrbbearings.com Job Role Overview: As a Plant Account Position holder, you will be crucial to ensuring the financial and operational efficiency of our Aurangabad plant. Key responsibilities include: Statutory Compliance: Manage all statutory payments (TDS, PF, PT, ESIC, water, telephone, electricity, etc.) on or before due dates. Ledger Management: Conduct ledger scrutiny of all expense ledgers and department codes, rectifying J.V. sheets. Audit and Reconciliation: Provide data to internal auditors for audit purposes and solve their queries. Reconcile all recovery accounts (bank loan, PF, society, ESIC, union, LWF, LIC, and canteen). Stock Management: Conduct physical stock taking of raw materials, work-in-progress, and components on September 30 and March 31 of each year. Verify physical stock at OSP vendors. Salary and Expenses: Prepare department-wise salary JVs and expense provisions and send them to the head office (HO) before the 7th of every month. Expense Variance Analysis: Prepare and send expense variance reports to HO and provide expense variance analysis on or before the 10th of every month. Government Compliance: Ensure compliance with government authorities (income tax, sales tax, and excise). Funds Management: Provide monthly fund requirements to HO. Service Tax Management: Take monthly service tax credit, prepare reversal service tax details, and forward them to HO for payment. Customer Complaints and Rejection: Prepare travel expenses details for attending customer complaints and circulate to line managers and the QC department. Prepare debit notes for line rejections of crank pins and send them to HO for booking in SAP. Investment Proof: Collect investment proof from staff and workers for income tax purposes. Energy Consumption: Prepare energy consumption reports and highlight abnormalities at the plant. Salary Preparation: Check salary templates and send them to the IT department for salary preparation. Cut-off Details: Prepare and send quarterly cut-off details to HO. Other Tasks: Prepare machine installation certificates, asset transfer forms, and follow up with the export department for POE documents. Qualification and Skills Required: A graduate degree with accounting knowledge. Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong attention to detail and organizational abilities. If you are interested in this role, please email your updated resume, including your total experience, education background, current location, current CTC, expected CTC, and notice period to ashwini.lokhande@nrb.co.in. Thank you for considering this opportunity. We look forward to hearing from you soon. Warm Regards, Ashwini Lokhande Talent Acquisition & Onboarding

column2: Are you a meticulous finance professional eager to ensure regulatory adherence and financial integrity? Vivre Panels, the design-centric arm of a prominent building materials conglomerate, is undergoing remarkable expansion. With a robust nationwide presence encompassing over 2,000 dealers and a dedicated following among architects and interior designers (30k strong on Instagram!), we are primed to extend our influence and emerge as the global frontrunner in innovative architectural materials. This role extends beyond standard accounting responsibilities; it offers the opportunity to contribute to our legacy. As the Accounting Compliance Specialist, you will be tasked with ensuring adherence to financial regulations, implementing robust compliance frameworks, and safeguarding our financial reputation. Key Responsibilities: Financial Recordkeeping : Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records, including accounts payable, accounts receivable and general ledger entries. Process Improvement : Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains in accounting procedures, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement solutions. Documentation and Documentation Management : Maintain organized and updated documentation related to accounting processes, policies, and procedures. Collaboration: Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including finance, legal, and operations teams, to ensure alignment on accounting and compliance matters. Are you the perfect fit for this role? At least 2 years of experience in the field of Accounting, Direct/Indirect Taxation and ROC compliances in a CA Firm Should be proficient in MS Excel  Should be well versed in Drafting work in accordance with the Companies Act (Board Resolutions, Minutes, Agreements etc)  Should be able to prepare books of accounts in Tally Should be able to make payroll entries  Should be able to communicate well and eager to learning new things This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team and contribute to the success of a rapidly growing company in the architectural and interior design industry. Vivre Panels offers a competitive compensation package, opportunities for professional development, and a supportive work environment.  Ready to join us? Apply now  to be part of our innovative and passionate team! Note:  The compensation package for this role will be determined based on the candidate's experience and performance throughout the recruitment process.

Through the right multidisciplinary team of professionals with the sector knowledge and subject matter expertise, EY GDS Assurance enables EY client teams to help worlds leading companies meet their audit requirements. EYs global Climate Change and Sustainability Services (CCaSS) enable companies to survive and grow in an environment where both financial and non-financial performance is critical. Our multidisciplinary teams help companies understand the risks and opportunities arising from climate change and sustainability and our solutions are spread across this spectrum. Our solutions include Climate Change & Decarbonisation, Sustainability Advisory, Non-Financial Reporting, Non-Financial Assurance, EHS and Managed Services. Position summary Climate Change and Sustainability Services (CCaSS) professionals provide assurance and advisory services including ESG/Sustainability Advisory, Sustainability/non-financial reporting, EHS, Climate Change and impact assessment studies. Our CCaSS team is growing exponentially, and as a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. You will work with clients to comprehend and navigate reporting standards (e.g., GRI, CSRD, SASB, Integrated Reporting, TCFD), develop processes, controls and technology-based solutions to support reporting and develop strategies addressing sustainability risks. You will also lead teams providing independent assurance over sustainability disclosures, based on frameworks like ISAE 3000 (Revised) and AA 1000. While the Manager will be based out of our Gurgaon/Bangalore/Mumbai/Kolkata/Hyderabad office, the individual will be required to travel to other countries (short term) for executing the client engagements. Primary responsibilities You will lead and plan the execution of projects and collaborate with colleagues across multiple service lines. You will support sustainability related advisory or assurance projects associated with systems implementations, and business process transformation. You will share relevant subject matter expertise to support the development of thought leadership on sustainability processes and controls and to create customized solutions for our clients. You will lead and execute the following key CCaSS solutions using global service delivery framework: ESG/ sustainability reporting Sustainability assurance Sustainability strategy ESG impact assessments ESG due diligence Supply chain sustainability   As a manager you will demonstrate management skills, including but not limited to the following: Creating a positive work environment within team. Monitoring workloads of the team while meeting client expectations. Providing candid, meaningful, and constructive feedback in a timely manner. Qualifications, skills, and experience Graduate or post-graduate degree in business administration, engineering, and other related discipline from reputed institutes. 8+ years of experience (graduates) and 5+ years of experience (post-graduates) preferably from consulting background, research thinktanks and/ or environment, and sustainability related areas. Experience in ESG reporting, strategy development, assurance, impact assessments, due diligence, supply chain sustainability, conducting trainings, etc. Excellent and demonstrable team & engagement management, problem solving and analytical skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills, including an ability to synthesize complex ideas into clear messages with stakeholders. Excellent MS Excel and MS PowerPoint skills. Flexibility and willingness to travel on short notice, as necessary.

column2: We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Audit Executive to join our team. The ideal candidate will hold a graduate or master's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field, along with professional certifications such as CA Inter, CIA, or ACCA. With 3 to 5 years of relevant experience in internal audit and accounting, the Audit Executive will play a pivotal role in evaluating and enhancing our internal control processes. Key Responsibilities: Conduct comprehensive internal audits of various departments and processes to assess the effectiveness of controls, accuracy of financial records, and compliance with policies and regulations. Develop risk-based audit plans and programs, including the identification of key controls, testing procedures, and evaluation methodologies. Perform walkthroughs and document process flows to identify control weaknesses and areas of potential risk. Test the design and operating effectiveness of internal controls through sample testing, data analysis, and documentation review. Prepare detailed audit reports summarizing findings, recommendations, and management responses in accordance with professional standards. Communicate audit results effectively to stakeholders, including senior management and department heads, and collaborate on action plans to address identified issues. Monitor the implementation of audit recommendations and track progress to ensure timely resolution. Professional certifications such as CA Inter, CIA, or ACCA are required. 3 to 5 years of experience in internal audit, accounting, or related field. Strong understanding of internal control frameworks, risk assessment methodologies, and audit techniques. Excellent analytical skills with the ability to identify issues, analyze data, and provide practical recommendations. Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to interact confidently with stakeholders at all levels. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Experience with audit management software or ERP systems is a plus.

column2: People from CA firm shall only apply.  Key Responsibilities: The proposed role requires a skilled leader with a track record of successfully leading a 10-12 member team in similar endeavors. The role primarily centers around monthly financial reporting and closing, deep expertise in direct and indirect taxation, and proficiency in international taxation. These responsibilities are particularly relevant when dealing with subsidiary entities within global organizations. Here's a breakdown of the key elements of this role: 1. Monthly Financial Reporting & Closing (R2R):  Your role will entail meticulous preparation of monthly and yearly accounts in accordance with Indian accounting standards and guidelines, all while adhering to strict deadlines. This includes overseeing departmental recording and analysis, budget comparisons, annual forecasts, multi-currency reporting, and assistance in consolidation with global accounts. 2. SAP / ERP Systems Reporting:  Your role includes supervising the processing of documentation within clients' accounting systems. This encompasses tasks such as data entry, expense claims, bank transactions, journal entries, and fixed asset accounting. 3. International Taxation: Given the global nature of clients, you will navigate the intricacies of international taxation. This involves managing end-to-end compliance and reporting for Indian and international subsidiaries and overseeing transfer pricing and intercompany agreement reviews. 4. Direct and Indirect Taxation: Your deep expertise in direct and indirect taxation is crucial. You will provide expert guidance to clients on their monthly tax obligations for transactions with their parent or sister entities besides day-day compliances, ensuring full agreement with relevant tax laws and regulations. 5. Year-End Audit & Auditor Liaison: You will play a pivotal role in facilitating comprehensive internal and statutory audits, collaborating closely with auditors to ensure precision, adherence to accounting standards, and regulatory compliance.. We are 5.5 days working with 2 saturdays off.

column2: Job Title:  Accounts Receivable Specialist Location:   Noida/ Gurugram  Job Summary: The Accounts Receivable Specialist is responsible for managing and overseeing all aspects of the company's accounts receivable process. This role ensures accurate and timely billing, processing of payments, and reconciliation of accounts. The Accounts Receivable Specialist will work closely with clients and internal teams to resolve any billing issues and maintain positive relationships. Key Responsibilities: Invoice Processing and Management: Generate and send out invoices to clients in a timely manner. Ensure all invoices are accurately coded and entered into the accounting system. Monitor and manage the invoice aging report, ensuring timely follow-up on overdue accounts. Payment Processing: Process incoming payments, including checks, credit cards, and electronic transfers. Accurately record payments in the accounting system. Reconcile payments and ensure proper allocation to customer accounts. Account Reconciliation: Perform regular account reconciliations to ensure all payments are accounted for and properly posted. Investigate and resolve discrepancies or issues related to accounts receivable. Collections: Proactively contact customers to follow up on overdue accounts. Work with clients to resolve any billing issues or disputes. Develop and implement effective collection strategies to reduce outstanding receivables. Reporting and Analysis: Prepare regular reports on accounts receivable status, aging analysis, and collection activities. Provide insights and recommendations to management based on accounts receivable trends and performance. Customer Relations: Maintain positive relationships with clients through effective communication and problem-solving. Respond promptly to client inquiries regarding invoices, payments, and account status. Compliance and Record-Keeping: Ensure compliance with company policies and relevant accounting regulations. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all accounts receivable activities. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to improve accounts receivable processes and implement best practices. Collaborate with internal teams to streamline workflows and enhance efficiency. Qualifications: Education:  Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field preferred. Experience: Minimum of 3+ years of experience in accounts receivable or a similar accounting role. Experience with accounting software (e.g Tally, QuickBooks, SAP, Oracle) and proficiency in Microsoft Excel. Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Attention to detail and high level of accuracy. Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively. Knowledge of accounting principles and practices. Customer service-oriented mindset. Work Environment: --------- 6 Days Working [ Monday to Saturday] Interested Candidate may share their resume at shubhika@vinove.com  NP-Immediate to Max 15 days

column2: We are looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Assistant Manager for product costing and financial analysis to join our team in the retail apparel industry. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the costing process in SAP, managing inventory, Financial Analysis, Book closing, Balance Sheet Preparation and generating accurate MIS (Management Information System) reports to support decision-making and optimize operational efficiency. Responsibilities: Costing Analysis and Management: Analyze product costing for apparel items, including raw materials, labor, and overhead costs. Review and evaluate production costs, pricing structures, and profit margins to ensure competitiveness and profitability. Develop and implement cost-saving initiatives and process improvements to enhance operational efficiency and reduce expenses. Monitor and control production costs to ensure adherence to budget and financial targets. Inventory Management: Oversee inventory planning, procurement, and control processes to optimize stock levels and minimize holding costs. Keeping track and control of inventory levels to ensure these are not above norms. Highlight exceptions and drive solutions with operating stakeholders. Conduct regular inventory audits and reconciliations to verify stock accuracy and integrity. Analyze inventory trends and aging reports to identify slow-moving or obsolete items and implement strategies to liquidate or minimize inventory write-offs. Book Closing and Balance Sheet Preparation Financial review of ledger balances Provisions Expense Control Profitability MIS Balance Sheet preparation  MIS Reporting and Analysis: Develop and maintain standardized MIS reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to costing, inventory, and operational metrics. Generate ad-hoc reports and analysis as required by management to support decision-making and strategic planning initiatives. Interpret financial data and performance metrics to identify trends, variances, and areas for improvement. Provide insights and recommendations based on MIS analysis to drive business growth and profitability. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, production, procurement,  to ensure alignment of costing , inventory and financial management strategies with business objectives. Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders to gather input, share information, and address issues related to costing and inventory management. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field.  CMA or equivalent professional certification with 6/7 years experience. Experience in costing, inventory management, or related roles, preferably in the retail apparel industry. Proficiency in cost accounting principles, inventory valuation methods, and financial analysis techniques. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and draw actionable insights. Advanced proficiency in MS Excel and other financial software applications.(SAP) Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and precision in data analysis and reporting. If you are a motivated and analytical professional with a passion for costing and inventory management in the retail apparel industry, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join our dynamic team and contribute to our continued success and growth
